Together, we will pile our plates high with fresh, vibrant fruits and vegetables and learn simple, delicious and affordable recipes to make at home. We will share our stories, celebrate our successes and receive support along our journey towards a healthy lifestyle.

title: St. Francis Center, Los Angeles
description: Since 1972, St. Francis Center has provided relief and support to homeless and extremely low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles. Much more than a soup kitchen or a food pantry, we offer a unique range of services to sustain and empower those in need and engaging volunteer opportunities Los Angeles. Welcoming all with joy, dignity and compassion, we dedicate ourselves every day to Serving Hope in our community.

title: Jumpstart Southern California
description: Jumpstart is working toward the day every child in America enters school prepared to succeed.

title: My Friends House Foundation
description: My Friends House is a 501(c) (3) non-profit human service organization whose mission is to provide life-sustaining staples that includes food, clothing, toiletries, and spiritual motivation to the economically disadvantaged, regardless of race, color, creed, or religious belief.

title: Little Tokyo Service Center
description: The mission of the Little Tokyo Service Center, a Community Development Corporation, is to meet the critical needs of people and to build community. Little Tokyo Service Center has developed a Financial Capability and Asset Building Program for residents in their low income and affordable housing.

title: Joshua's Heart Foundation
description: The primary objective of this foundation is to Stomp out Hunger. JHF , a 501(c) 3 non-for-profit organization, empowers, needy people to improve their quality of life. We do so by providing items if basic necessity, such as food and other grocery products, and by effectively engaging and educating communities at home and abroad about committing to fight hunger and poverty on a global basis.

title: Voices for Children Foundation
description: The mission of Voices For Children Foundation, Inc. is to raise funds to ensure that every abused, abandoned and neglected child in Miami-Dade County has a court-appointed Guardian ad Litem (GAL) and that financial assistance and other resources are available for their health, educational, and social needs.

title: Urgent Inc.
description: URGENT, Inc. is a 501 (c) (3) Miami, FL based youth and community development organization dedicated to empowering young minds to transform their communities. Guided by the principles of innovation, growth and transformation URGENT sees young people as the drivers of change and works to provide empowering opportunities to create the next generation of social change agents.

title: Camillus House
description: Camillus House offers a wide range of on-going and project-related assignments. Some people volunteer every week and some volunteer for special projects or events only. Some volunteers can only commit to a few months. There are volunteer opportunities to fit your interest.

title: New World Symphony
description: The New World Symphony, America’s Orchestral Academy (NWS), prepares graduates of distinguished music programs for leadership roles in professional orchestras and ensembles. Artistic Director Michael Tilson Thomas and Lin and Ted Arison, NWS has helped launch the careers of more than 1000 alumni.

title: Seasons Hopsice and Palliative Care
description: There are many ways to be a Seasons Volunteer! -You can visit with patients and family members to provide companionship, share memories, go for walks, proved respite, and write letters. -If you have a pet you can be a part of our loyal friend pet team and provide some fun companionship, comfort, and "wet" kisses to our patients and their families -If you can play an instrument of any kind you can provide music companionship to patients and families through music performance and entertainment. -You can also provide spiritual support to patients and their families in collaboration with Seasons trained Hospice chaplains. As well, you can be an indirect volunteer and provide our staff with administrative assistance, send cards, contribute to newsletters and mailings, and assist in volunteer recruitment.

title: Art Studio Miami
description: Art Studio Inc.'s mission is to provide a safe space for year-round youth empowerment programs in the impoverished 33150 area of Miami.

title: Students Working for Equal Rights
description: To support fair and equal integration of immigrants in the united states, encourage their civic participation, develop strategic campaigns that furthers a progressive vision of fundamental rights for all with an analysis grounded on the root causes of migration, and to uphold every individual's right to live without fear.

title: Victim Response Inc. The Lodge
description: We envision a shelter system which provides empowerment based advocacy and services for survivors of gender violence to live a safe and autonomous life.

title: Heartland Hospice Serving South Florida
description: Heartland Hospice is part of the HCR ManorCare family, a leading provider of home health care, hospice care, skilled nursing, memory care and post-acute care. We deliver care in 23 states and are the third largest hospice provider in the nation.

title: Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen
description: Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen, in addition to our food program, has our committed staff and volunteers work with guests to ensure they are receiving full benefits, connect them to additional supportive services, help with job applications and even reunite them with family members.

title: Project EATS
description: Project EATS is a neighborhood-based project that uses art, urban agriculture, partnerships, and social enterprise to sustainable produce and equitable distribute essential resources within and between our communities. Especially those where people live on working class and low-incomes.

title: Sing for Hope Youth Corps
description: The Sing for Hope Youth Corps, part of a network of NYC Youth Leadership Councils, will motivate teenage musicians & artists to use the power of the arts for good. We need YOU to shape the projects other teens can work on & bring your creative ideas for spreading the word.

title: Project Sunshine
description: Project Sunshine empowers a dynamic corps of over 15,000 volunteers to bring programming - recreational, educational and social service (HIV and nutritional counseling) - to 100,000 children facing medical challenges and their families in 175 cities across the US, Canada, China, Israel and Kenya.

title: NY Artists Unlimited
description: NY Artists Unlimited, founded in 1982, is dedicated to taking professional theatre to under-served audiences.

title: lifeBeat
description: Lifebeat – Music Fights HIV/AIDS is the leading national nonprofit focused on educating kids (13-29) about HIV/AIDS and STD prevention . We mobilize the Music Industry ‘s resources to raise awareness of HIV/AIDS and STDs at live music events, and via broadcast, digital, social, and print platforms.

title: Episcopal Community Services
description: Episcopal Community Services empowers vulnerable individuals and families by providing high quality social and educational services that affirm human dignity and promote social justice.

title: Lenfest Center
description: We believe that every child that we serve deserves the opportunity to reach his or her potential, and to explore as many creative outlets as possible, whether it be sports, art, poetry, dance or chess.

title: Awbury Arboretum
description: All high school youth are welcome to join our team as we share our talents and develop skills in urban agriculture, culinary arts, and entrepreneurship at the TLC Market Garden. Middle school youth volunteers will also be considered.

title: Spells Writing Lab
description: Spells Writing Lab is a Philadelphia-based 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that develops the creative and expository writing abilities of school-age children through free, fun, and imaginative writing programs and teacher development opportunities.

title: Face to Face Germantown
description: At Face to Face struggling families, individuals and the homeless are welcomed and treated with dignity and respect. Our goal is to meet basic human needs and reduce suffering; thereby assisting our guests to a better future.

title: SHARE Food Program
description: The SHARE Food Program is a nonprofit organization serving a regional network of community organizations engaged in food distribution, education, and advocacy. SHARE promotes healthy living by providing affordable wholesome food to those willing to contribute through volunteerism.

title: Greensgrow
description: Greensgrow engages our neighborhoods in cultivating social entrepreneurship, urban agriculture, and community greening.

title: Lutheran Settlement House
description: Established in 1902, Lutheran Settlement House (LSH) is a non-profit, community-based organization committed to serving children, adults, and families living in Philadelphia. Over the past century, the programs and services offered by LSH have changed in response to the evolving needs of the community.

title: St. Francis Inn Ministries
description: Formed in the spirit of the Gospel and inspired by the life and compassion of Sts. Francis and Clare of Assisi, we try to meet the immediate daily needs of the people we serve with food, clothing and hospitality.

title: Pegasus Riding Academy
description: Pegasus Therapeutic Riding Academy is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization in Philadelphia, PA dedicated to providing therapeutic horseback riding programs for children and adults with physical, developmental, and intellectual disabilities.

title: Project H.O.M.E.
description: Project HOME is a Philadelphia non-profit organization empowering individuals to break the cycle of poverty and homelessness through affordable housing, employment, health care, and education

title: Excelsior Community Food Pantry
description: The Excelsior Community Food Pantry offers free groceries to all in need every Saturday. Our website offers information about our history, our mission, our core values, and how we operate.. If you are interested in volunteering at upcoming pantries or making a donation, please contact us!

title: City Youth Now
description: City Youth Now works to bridge the gap for youth in crisis by providing programs that promote stability and personal growth.

title: Galeria de la Raza
description: Founded in 1970, the Galeria is a non-profit community-based arts organization whose mission is to foster public awareness and appreciation of Chicano/Latino art and serve as a laboratory where artists can both explore contemporary issues in art, culture and civic society, and advance intercultural dialogue. To implement our mission, the Galeria supports Latino artists in the visual, literary, media and performing art fields whose works explore new aesthetic possibilities for socially committed art.

title: Project Access
description: To be the leading provider of vital health, education and employment services to families, children, and seniors living in low-income housing communities. Our goal is to help keep family members employed, children in school, and seniors active.

title: Girls on the Run of the Bay Area
description: The mission of Girls on the Run of the Bay Area is to educate and build confidence in young girls through non-competitive, curriculum-based running programs in San Francisco, Marin, Alameda, San Mateo, and Contra Costa Counties.

title: Children's Book Project
description: The Children's Book Project makes free books available to the children that need them.

title: Family House, Inc.
description: Family House serves as a home away from home for families of children with cancer and other life-threatening illnesses by providing physical comfort and emotional support, free from financial concerns.

title: Seabury Resources for Aging
description: Seabury Resources for Aging's mission is to provide personalized, affordable services and housing options to help older adults in the greater Washington, DC area live with independence and dignity.

title: DC Central Kitchen
description: DC Central Kitchen is America's leader in reducing hunger with recycled food, training unemployed adults for culinary careers, serving healthy school meals, and rebuilding urban food systems through social enterprise.
